posts.post_content:
Posted By: Denny Walsh
SOLD 
THANK YOU ALL, 
DENNY

This Is the ONLY 1880's Merchant Gargling Oil Set in which they all have the same Trade Advertising Back(That I have ever seen or know about) It took me over three years to put it together. I have never even seen(or heard of a set) that had 4 of the same Ad Backs. 

I'm on my way to Iraq, So I'm selling some things that will help me smooth over the transition to get me over there...... 

I have a little bit of money into this set, but I'm only interested in finding it a good home and recovering what I have into it.

If your at all interested, please email me at:

irishdenny17@yahoo.com 


<a href="http://tinyurl.com/52hvg5" target="_new" rel="nofollow">[url]http://tinyurl.com/52hvg5</a[/url]>


First one to strike a deal with me, its theirs!
THIS IS THE AD BACK ON ALL OF THEM!


[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1213758241.JPG[/IMG]"> 

Life's Grand,
Denny Walsh

Posted By: barrysloate
Denny- I wish you the very best on your difficult journey and hope you are back on American soil very soon.

Posted By: Denny Walsh
Thank You Barry, 
  As Always, Your kindness Is welcomed. It won't be at all easy, but the cause completely out weighs the means!

Your Irish Friend....

Life's Grand,
Denny Walsh

Posted By: Lyle
what a pleasure it was working with Denny . He is a real class act and an incredibly fast shipper . Although I usually collect exclusively Cobb , I was very impressed with the 1880's humor and the details of these cards .I may have to get out more often .[IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/happy.gif[/IMG]

Posted By: Jon Canfield
Denny,

Although I don't believe we've ever spoken, I wanted to echo Barry's sentiment and wish you the best while overseas.  I'm sure I speak for the collective Net54 community when I say I look forward to seeing you on the board again soon.  

- Jon

Posted By: Denny Walsh
You Guys, "Are just waayyy to Kind!"

I will miss you all dearly, but I will do my best to get internet access at least to chime in now and again......

Life's Grand,
Denny Walsh
